result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Charles Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Charles Allen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Installment Payment Agreement for Fine or Forfeiture.
Pay $50 per month beginning April 15, 2016.  Failure to pay will be one day in jail for every $30 or part thereof that remains unpaid with Huber consecutive to any other time being served.

Larry Charles Allen, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Charges amended to single misdemeanor charge. Defendant pleads no contest. Fined $473.50, inclusive of costs, $50/mo payment plan.

Violation: Possession of Cocaine (2nd)
Issuing Agency: Green County Sheriff's Department
Conditions:   Must notify District Attorney, Clerk of Court's Office and own Attorney of any address change within 24 hours.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.  May not posssess any drug paraphernalia.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Larry Charles Allen, defendant appeared in Court in custody by video means from Green County Jail with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.  Signature bond set. Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
